Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and dissapeared without notice.

Case reference: 2008003199.CaseDesc: Police received information that Toivo Reinikainen had not returned to work at the Great West Timber Camp on the Deadhorse Road in Walsh Twp (northern Ontario).  He had been observed on site on September 26, 1984 at 4:00 a.m. by his co-workers.  The camp location is a relatively remote area, access is by Deadhorse Road which is open to the public.

Case reference: 2014003036.CaseDesc: Originally from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Regan Pace Ambrose is believed to have gone missing in Japan. After being recruited to work at a Japanese hospital, Miss Ambrose moved to Tokuyama, Yamaguchi, Japan. She was last seen on January 11, 1998 after finishing a shift at work. She was reportedly seen in the area of Mount Aso in Kumamoto, Kyushu Japan on January 10th, 1998. Japanese and Canadian authorities investigated; however, met with negative results.

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2021000929.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2020, Ronald O'Kell was reported missing to the New York State Police in Niagara Falls, New York. Ronald’s unoccupied vehicle was recovered from a parking lot on Goat Island, New York. It is suspected that he may have jumped into the falls.

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Mr. Bennett never arrived at Matheson Island. Mr. Bennett is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006009499.CaseDesc: On February 23, 2003, Fred Takerer was reported missing by his son. Mr. Takerer had physical limits and was not able to get around easily. Police have not been able to locate Mr. Takerer and believe his disappearance to be suspicious.

Case reference: 2010003499.CaseDesc:
On March 21, 2010 Chung Law left work on Dundas St, London ON. He told his employer that he was experiencing some stress and would be taking a couple of days off. Mr. Law spoke to his wife, who lives in Vaughan, ON, and told her he was coming home for a visit. He spoke to his employer the next day, saying he was in Toronto and that he did not want to return to work in London. Mr. Law never did arrive home. Investigation has revealed that Mr. Law may have travelled to Toronto by bus. 

In April, 2011 a right foot contained within a black boot was located in the river flats of the Thames River in Elgin County. The area was searched and no further remains were found. DNA confirmed that the foot was that of Mr. Law.

Scar: Left Thigh, Surgery scar on upper left thigh

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2014002557.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2000, Craig Snider left his family's place in Coquitlam to go to work as a commercial fisherman at Stevenson Marina in Richmond, British Columbia and has never been seen or heard from since. 
Mr Snider commuted regularly from Port Alberni, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2012020009.CaseDesc: Kathleen Wattley was last seen on June 13, 1992. It is unusual for Kathleen not to return home to her children. Kathleen was known to live a high risk life style.

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2010006499.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2007, Mark Brazau was reported missing by a friend.  Mark was last seen at his place of work in Toronto Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Short, Over ears, receding hairline, beard and a moustache

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014006199.CaseDesc: Albert RIDDY went missing from his residence between April 5 and July 30, 2013. He has not been located since. The circumstances of his disappearance are considered suspicious.

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2021056492.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1991, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered near Placentia Bay in Newfoundland and Labrador. He is believed to have been between 6’0 and 6’2 in height.

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Hair: Black, White, Straight, Short, Grey/black, messy; Beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, Irregular, broken/missing lower and upper  - decayed

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.
Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest
Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents

Case reference: 2014002090.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2000, Stephane Levesque was seen for the last time at his home in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Stephane went to move his car from one side of the street to the other, and he never came back.

Coat: Black, Winter coat with Skidoo written in yellow

Case reference: 2014001474.CaseDesc: Pamela was last seen at her apartment complex on Lloyd Street in the city of Greater Sudbury, Ontario, in December of 1978.  She had left her son with her neighbour, and never returned. Her family had been expecting her to visit over the Christmas holidays, but she never went. When the family began trying to find her, they found that she had been missing for some time. She had left all her identification and personal belongings behind.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. Mr. Flett  did not show up at the site and crew members thought he had returned to camp. Mr. Flett  was reported missing three days later to RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Mr. Flett  has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, plaid and button up

Case reference: 2021050310.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of October 13, 2021, Cody Harper was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Cody has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2016065650.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2008, the skeletal remains of a male was recovered from the Lower Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist Docks below Niagara Falls. No clothing or personal effects were recovered. These remains may have been in the water for many years.

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2016061134.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from Lakewood Beach, Lake Erie in Malden Township of Amherstburg. He was estimated to have been there for 1-3 years. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5’7"-5’8", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2005005499.CaseDesc: On June 28, 1991, an unidentified man was discovered in the Niagara River located in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Shoes: White, Running, Brand: "Pro Wing Eagle"; size 12
Socks: White, Blue, White socks with a blue stripe
Scar: Right Leg, 24cm in length, on the inside of right lower leg, from ankle to upper shin
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, Healed fracture of the tibia

Case reference: 2014005817.CaseDesc: On January 13, 2008, August Mikson was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars
Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014005112.CaseDesc: Tian You Li left his extended family home in East Vancouver to go for his routine walk. He never returned. He suffers from Alzheimers and may be confused and disorientated.

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018054598.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 2018, Dwayne Lavallee was seen for the last time in his vehicle leaving the Ebb and Flow First Nation community and the vehicle was located on September 26th, north of the community of Ste. Rose du Lac, Manitoba.

Jacket: Black, Yellow, Work jacket with reflective stripes

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2014003001.CaseDesc: Mr. Westbrook was last seen during the late afternoon/early evening hours on September 8, 1994. Mr. Westbrook had stopped at the Highwayman Restaurant located at 3001 Highway 11 North to gas up a motor home as he was attempting to return to Strathroy, Ontario. Family members had followed him in their vehicle and took away his keys to prevent him from driving any further as they were concerned about his driving. After a confrontation with his family members he was last seen walking southbound on Highway 11 in an agitated state. He was observed walking and hitchhiking heading towards the city of North Bay, ON. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015059300.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., Tommy Chear was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Tommy had advised that he would be home later, but never returned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, Framed, Framed glasses

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2013000101.CaseDesc: Oswald Bear left his parents home in Peguis First Nation, Manitoba to go to the bush a short distance east of the house and cut some wood. Mr. Bear was very familiar with the area and enjoyed chopping wood. He spent a lot of time there and knew it well. He had never been lost in the bush and had never failed to return home previously. He visited at his sister's residence nearby at 6:15 p.m. Shortly thereafter, his sister told him that he should go home so that their mother wouldn't worry. When Mr. Bear left his sisters's residence, his intention was to go home, but he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002960.CaseDesc: David Wycotte was last seen by his family on November 1, 1975, in Williams Lake, British Columbia. Up until December 1975, David was working in Winfield, British Columbia as a berry picker. David has been known to travel the area and the United States looking for labour jobs.

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie was last seen at home.

Jacket: Green Orange and Yellow Plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2014001151.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1977, the body of a young unidentified man was found in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had taken his own life with a new “Savage 240 Series P” rifle that had been purchased in Gatineau, Quebec five days earlier.

Jacket: Corduroy, Tan, Padded with leather pads on shoulder
Shirt: White, With blue dots, Made in France

Case reference: 2005007699.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1986, a Caucasian male was found in the Don River, near 62 Villiers Street, in Toronto, Ontario. He was estimated to be between 25-45 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140 lbs and his length was measured at 5’11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth show heavy tartar accumulation and tobacco stain. His appendix was present and he was circumcised. He is thought to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, Long sideburns, a moustache which was long and curled to the side of lower lips.
Teeth: Had all of his teeth and there are some fillings as well as numerous cavities and dental abscesses.
Shoes: Canvas, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, A pair of Bauer brand shoes, made from canvas with silver stripes on the sides, size 10.
Other: Also had a pair of nail clippers; a bottle opener; and a small key on a key ring.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wearing a silver-coloured REMEX digital wrist watch
Socks: Wool, Blue, White, Mid-calf woolen socks which were blue on the sole and white on the top

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2020043711.CaseDesc: Alfred L'Arrivee was last seen on May 3, 1973 at a rural property where he resided in Keg River, Alberta. Alfred has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2020008724.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1979, Irvin Lasinskas was last seen at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Irvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Mr. MAJOR.

Case reference: 2020008388.CaseDesc: On December 10, 1982, David Templar was seen for the last time when he was picked up by his father for a visitation. David was to be returned home to his mother on December 12, but never returned. It is believed that his father may have brought him to India.

Coat: Other, Parka; Khaki coloured with white fur trim on hood

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White
Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large

Case reference: 2012020086.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1993, Willard Brass, 52 years old, was last seen at a residence in Yorkton, SK. He was reported missing on May 27, 1993, by his family. Searches and investigation have failed to locate him.

Hat: Black, Red, ball cap, crest of sunsets, with horse and rider, "Black Hills South Dakota" in writing
Tattoo: Left Hand, love (text) and 4 aces across the fingers
Right Forearm, dagger and a heart
Left Forearm, born to be wild 1962 (text)

Case reference: 2007003599.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2000 Marilyn Zaitzeff left her cottage located on Lambert Island, Lake Superior. She was operating a personal watercraft at the time. The watercraft was located overturned several hundred metres away from the cottage. Mrs. Zaitzeff has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006018499.CaseDesc: Tony Gikoff was last seen July 9, 1955, near Colborne, Ontario, at a property he rented to tenants. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 2012020127.CaseDesc: Jocelyne Dubé, 57, was last seen on October 2nd 2008. On the night of her disappearance, she received a phone call from a friend and a visit from her daughter at her Piedmont, Quebec residence.  A few days after the disappearance, her abandoned vehicle was found in Montreal, Quebec. Everything indicates that the car had been there for a few days.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014007309.CaseDesc: On August 20, 1997, a canoeist found a human skull on the Moose Jaw River, just south of Moose Jaw, SK. The skull was examined by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the skull had been exposed to the elements for 50 to 100 years. It was that of a 12 year old, possibly Caucasian, female. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014001219.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1994, the remains of a man were found in Cates Park in North Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had a healed fracture to his right wrist and may have had an old injury to the lower back. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.  Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Belt: Beige, Khaki, webbed with brass buckle

Case reference: 2012020157.CaseDesc: The partial skeletal remains of this adult male were recovered on a ranch property on Lindley Creek Road in close proximity to the Shulus Indian Reserve in Merritt BC.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Transverse fracture across base of olecranon

Case reference: 2021024071.CaseDesc: On April 19, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in the woods east of Huntsville, Ontario. A vape, cigarette filter and four medical diagnostic tabs were located nearby.

Case reference: 2012020172.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were found in a wooded area in Surrey, near Scott Road and 64th Avenue.

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On October 2nd, 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. Investigators concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Ms.Klok has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006007699.CaseDesc: Kelvin Norris left his residence on November 27, 1984 at about 11:00 pm, he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004122.CaseDesc: Maria Evangelista was last seen on January 27, 1997, in Montreal. Maria had called her mother to tell her that she no longer wanted to return to the hospital and would like to work in California. Maria's luggage was found in a hotel, in San Francisco, on February 7, 1997.

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2016069136.CaseDesc:
This left lower arm and hand were recovered from the CPR rail yard in Windsor on March 25, 2014. The partial limb is from a young adult male who has brown skin. There are numerous tattoos present, most of which do not appear to have been professionally done. While the limbs appear to have been separated from the body after death, there is the possibility that the person remains alive. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be days to months.
Remains located in the CPR Freight Yard in Windsor on a lesser used track.  Biographic ancestry testing predicts person of Americas or mixed Americas and European Ancestry.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Unrecognizable designs of partial tattoos

Case reference: 2012020088.CaseDesc: Norbert Couillonneur was last seen on Thursday, May 27, 2010, at Pinehouse Lake, SK, wearing blue jeans and a light blue t-shirt. He is known to travel back and forth from Pinehouse Lake to Canoe Lake, SK.

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014001130.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1972, the body of a young man was found in the Fraser River near Port Coquitlam, British Columbia. The pathologist described him as being “short and chubby” and noted that he had had extensive dental work. It is believed that he died several weeks before his remains were recovered.

Case reference: 2013000091.CaseDesc: An unidentified male was found in False Creek near the Maritime Museum on May 7th 1998. The deceased had a pack of matches from the Bridges restaurant in his pocket

Teeth: Visible Missing, Two front upper teeth on the left side
Foreign Object: Matches found in pocket from Bridges Restaurant

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Peter Russell Yellowbird was reported missing by his family after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for so long. It is believed that Mr. Yellowbird’s last known location was in the Downtown area of Edmonton. Mr. Yellowbird’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest foul play.

Case reference: 2020008535.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1991, at approximately 1:00pm, Martin Stocker was last seen at his retirement home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.
